This E21 shows 194k miles and is now offered at no reserve with an owner’s handbook, a spare set of 13″ steel wheels, partial service records, and a clean Idaho title.

Finished from the factory in Sierra Beige (012), the car was repainted under prior ownership approximately 20 years ago. Details include chrome-finished impact bumpers with black accents as well as quad headlights, a left-side mirror, a rear window defroster, and pop-out rear vent windows. Blemishes are noted on various body panels.

The 13″ Mahle-BBS wheels were powder-coated in super chrome in 2018 and are mounted with 185/70 Barum Brillantis 2 tires showing a mixture of 2015 and 2018 date codes. Stopping power is provided by power-assisted front discs and rear drums.

The front bucket seats were reupholstered in Gobi Tan vinyl under previous ownership. Appointments include an analog clock, a heater, and an Alpine cassette stereo. The selling dealer notes that the air conditioning compressor has been removed and that cracks are evident in the dashboard.

The four-spoke steering wheel frames a 120-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a 6,400-rpm redline, and auxiliary gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The selling dealer notes that the directional indicator remains illuminated when the key is removed. The six-digit odometer shows 194k miles, approximately 75 of which have been added by the selling dealer.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission. Work in preparation for the sale involved changing the transmission fluid, resurfacing the flywheel, and replacing the rear main seal, clutch, pressure plate, and pilot and throw-out bearings.

A spare set of 13″ steel wheels mounted with older 185/70 Wynstar Phaser R13 tires is included in the sale. An owner’s handbook and partial service records also accompany the vehicle.
